project.teaser: In NEB-STAR, 16 partners will join forces to make the transition to climate-neutral cities inclusive, beautiful and sustainable - for, by and with all stakeholders. Stavanger as the first-generation NEB Lighthouse will provide experimentation, demonstration, insight and...
project.objective: In NEB-STAR, 16 partners will join forces to make the transition to climate-neutral cities inclusive, beautiful and sustainable - for, by and with all stakeholders. Stavanger as the first-generation NEB Lighthouse will provide experimentation, demonstration, insight and guidance on NEB principles in urban transitions in cooperation with twinning cities Prague and Utrecht, and peers in Europe and the Nordics. The project will demonstrate how Territorial Transformation Plans can be operationalised with NEB principles to accelerate the journey towards climate neutrality. In NEB-STAR, NEB principles will be used to address four emblematic challenges: (1) co-creating a new sense of aesthetics for climate-neutral cities and communities that captures places' unique qualities, history and potential, and generates a sense of belonging, pride and ownership; (2) Reconnecting with nature to boost resilience and a sense of community, giving new life to the spaces in between buildings through food and nature; (3) Creating temporary meeting spaces in urban transition areas, that embrace diversity and strengthen the identity and uniqueness of people and places that need it most; (4) Co-creating co-benefits for the neighbourhood and city through multi-functional use of spaces and infrastructures. The project will deliver a Detailed Roadmap for full-scale implementation of Stavanger’s Territorial Transformation Plan, supported by an extensive Co-Creation Process, a Portfolio of Policy Strategies and Tools, Financial and Partnership Models. The plans will be co-created with local stakeholders and partners, tested in Demonstrators in the three cities, jointly evaluated with stakeholders and experts, and exploited and replicated in cooperation with Nordic and European NEB and Missions communities. The NEB-STAR Impact Model will capture the social, cultural, financial, governance and technical impact on the built environment, and the stakeholders that affect / are affected by them.
project.title: New European Bauhaus STAvangeR
project.keywords: Territorial transformation plan, re-skilling society, New European Bauhaus, co-creation process, progress stories, aesthetics of climate-neutral cities, nature- and food-based solutions

article.title: New European Bauhaus for green urban transformation

result.title: Executive Plan for the initial implementation of the Stavanger Territorial Transformation Plan (initial version)
result.description: This is the initial version of the Executive Plan for implementation of the Stavanger TTP, with input from T1.2-1.5. (Linked to T1.1)

result.title: NEB-STAR twinning reports (initial version)
result.description: This report summarises the discussions, qualification, and fine-tuning of the the Co-Creation Process, Portfolio and Executive Plan, the expert feedback on the development and execution of the TTP and Testbeds, and the testing the transferability and enrichment of the Portfolio with Prague and Utrecht in T1.6 and T1.7.

result.title: NEB-STAR Learning Session report 1
result.description: This is the first report on the Learning Sessions organised among Stavanger partners and local stakeholders and summarises the the learnings that were fed back towards piloting and long-term planning (WP1-2-3) to optimise the local benefits of the project. (Linked to T5.1)

result.title: Feasibility Studies for Demonstrators in Pedersgata 1
result.description: This report summarises the Feasibility Studies based on the initial list of Demonstrators, supported by the Co-Creation Process and T2.2-T2.3, as well as STAS for Partnership Models and PU as building owner. (Linked to T2.1)

result.title: Open Science and Data Management Plan 1
result.description: This report is the initial version that develops the Data Management Plan (DMP), and details the Open Science approach and Research Data Management, including open access to research data, with all beneficiaries and WPs.(Linked to T7.2, initial version)

result.title: Feasibility Studies for Demonstrators in Pedersgata 2
result.description: This report summarises the Feasibility Studies based on the initial list of Demonstrators, supported by the Co-Creation Process and T2.2-T2.3, as well as STAS for Partnership Models and PU as building owner. (Linked to T2.1)

result.title: Inclusiveness and Diversity Management Plan 1
result.description: This report will develop and evolve the plan for inclusiveness and diversity management across the project as defined in Sec.1.2.2.(Linked to T7.3, initial version)

result.title: Open Science and Data Management Plan 2
result.description: This report maintains and evolves the Data Management Plan (DMP), and details the Open Science approach and Research Data Management, including open access to research data, with all beneficiaries and WPs.(Linked to T7.2, updated version)

result.title: Feasibility Studies for Demonstrators in Site 4016 1
result.description: This report summarises the Feasibility Studies based on the initial list of Demonstrators, supported by the Co-Creation Process and T3.2-T3.3, NE for Partnership Models, SK for integration with surrounding neighbourhoods. (Linked to T3.1)

result.title: Geodesign for a Circular Economy in Urban Regions - Report on Master Students' Output 2024

result.description: This report summarises the development and continuous revision of a Co-Creation Process which empowers citizens and professional stakeholders to co-design and co-deliver actions in their city to implement the systemic changes of governance to support the transition. (Linked to T1.1)

result.title: Co-Creation Process for NEB Stavanger (intermediate version)

(Linked to T1.1)

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.
